description: Send this trap when the MAC table is filled. The
interval between two traps generated should be longer
than hpnicfMacTabTrapInterval.

event.Summary: MAC table is full, Table length: $v1

description: The length of the MAC table.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfMacTabLen

description: Send this trap when the MAC table is almost full. The
interval between two traps generated should be longer
than hpnicfMacTabTrapInterval.
Send this trap when the ARP table is filled. The
interval between two traps generated should be longer
than hpnicfArpTabTrapInterval.

event.Summary: ARP table is full, Table length: $v1

description: The length of the ARP table.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfArpTabLen

description: Send this trap when the dynamic ARP number of the
port exceeds the limitation. The object hpnicfArpTabLen
describes the limitation of the max dynamic ARP number
of this port. The interval between two traps should be
longer than hpnicfArpTabTrapInterval.

event.Summary: Dynamic ARP number of the port exceeded the limit

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfArpPortDynamicEntryFullTrap HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfArpTabLen i 9999 IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE

description: The length of the ARP table.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfArpTabLen

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of the
manufacturer, the product name and the version of the
interface hardware/software.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifDescr

description: Send this trap when the routing table is filled. The
interval between two traps generated should be longer
than hpnicfRtTabTrapInterval.

event.Summary: Routing table is full, Table length: $v1

description: The length of the routing table. The detail
routing tables also use the same object.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfRtTabLen

description: Send this trap when the detail routing table is filled. The
interval between two traps generated should be longer than
hpnicfRtTabTrapInterval.

event.Summary: Detail routing table is full, Table length: $v2

description: The index value which uniquely identifies an entry
in the hpnicfDetailRtTrapTable.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfDetailRtProType

description: The length of the routing table. The detail
routing tables also use the same object.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfRtTabLen

description: Send this trap when the default route is deleted.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfDefaultRtDelTrap HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfDetailRtProType i 1 HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfDefaultRtNextHopType i 0 HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfDefaultRtNextHop s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfDefaultRtOutIf i 9999

description: The index value which uniquely identifies an entry
in the hpnicfDetailRtTrapTable.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfDetailRtProType

description: The IP address type of the next hop of the default route.
The value must be ipv4 or ipv6
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfDefaultRtNextHopType

description: The IP address of the next hop of the default route.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfDefaultRtNextHop

description: The index value which uniquely identifies the
local interface through which the next hop of this
route should be reached. The interface identified
by a particular value of this index is the same
interface as identified by the same value of
ifIndex.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfDefaultRtOutIf

description: Send this trap when the multicast table is filled. The
interval between two traps generated should be longer
than hpnicfMulticastTabTrapInterval.

event.Summary: Multicast table $v1 is full, Table length: $v2

description: Defining the type of the multicast table, layer2 or layer3.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfMulticastTabType

description: The length of the multicast table.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfMulticastTabLen

description: Send this trap when the ND table is filled. The
interval between two traps generated should be longer
than hpnicfNdTabTrapInterval.

event.Summary: ND table is full, Table length: $v1

description: The length of the ND table.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-TRAP-MIB::hpnicfNdTabLen

description: If no trap occurs during the interval spicified by
hpnicfPeriodicalTrapInterval, an hpnicfPeriodicalTrap
will be generated. If the interval is set to 0, no
hpnicfPeriodicalTrap will be generated.
